result.execSummary:
The defendant Felecia R. Busch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Counts #1 and #2:
The Court IMPOSES 2 years Prison consisting of 18 months Initial Confinement and 6 months Extended Supervision on each count, concurrent to one another but consecutive.

The Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $2,039 to Comfort Suites of Johnson Creek

Per Standing Order Defendant is to pay 10% restitution surcharge
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no presence in bars or taverns or liquor stores

--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--maintain absolute sobriety

--drug testing per agent

Arresting Agency: Johnson Creek PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Felecia R. Busch

records.addlTxt: No updated address information - unable to forward (MG 3-26-18)
Probation review hearing on March 15, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of the Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on April 8, 2016 before the Honorable J. Mac Davis

Reserve Judge Mac Davis presiding for Branch IV

Case called at 11:52am [mo]
Defendant Felecia R. Busch in court with attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Counts # 1 and #2; factual basis given; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Counts #1 and #2:
The Court IMPOSES 2 years Prison consisting of 18 months Initial Confinement and 6 months Extended Supervision on each count, concurrent to one another but consecutive.
Shall the Defendant be revoked, the Court finds Defendant eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Earned Release Program

The Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars or taverns or liquor stores 
--drug testing per agent
--to pay restitution in the amount of $2,039 to Comfort Suites of Johnson Creek
--to pay statutory costs



The Court leaves open sentence credit for submission of stipulation of parties
recess: 12:12pm

Case called at 9:52 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Felecia R. Busch appears via video, in-custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
Court continues bond as previously set
Atty Hagemann requests matter be set for DA PTC & STC 
Recess: 9:57 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 3/2/16 at 10:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 4/8/16 at 11:00 am - Send notices
Original signatures received from Robert Ellsworth Correctional on 1/29/16 signed on 1/26/16 with attachments
with attachments that were originally sent with the bond to Robert Ellsworth
Clerks note: e-mail sent to SPD regarding representation
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 9:36 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Felecia R. Busch appears via telephone, in-custody. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds audio technology is working properly, for the record indicates that matter was scheduled for video, but the video at 
institution is not working properly, so it was requested that Miss Busch appear via telephone.

Miss Busch informs the Court that she has not received a copy of the complaint
Court reads the complaint to Miss Busch
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Miss Busch informs the Court that she would like counsel on this matter 
Court on Its own motion enters a Not Guilty plea on the Defendant's behalf

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No presence at or be on the premises of the Comfort Suites, Johnson Creek
Recess: 9:43 am 

NEXT: (1) Clerk to call SPD and request them to contact Miss Busch regarding representation (2) Schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 2/5/16 at 9:30 am - Send notices **ADDRESS PLEA/SPEEDY**
From the State ref location of the defendant
